publisher.publisher-name: Military Operations Research Society in cooperation with the Military Applications Society (MAS) of the Institute for Operations Research and Management Science (INFORMS)

title-group.article-title: The Prevalence of Sparsely Reported Events

bio.p: Brian McCue is a graduate of Hamilton College and the Massachusetts Institute of Technology. He has worked as a defense analyst for 31 years, first in private industry; then in the Department of Defense, where he wrote U-Boats in the Bay of Biscay as a Senior Fellow at the National Defense University; then at the United States Congress’s Office of Technology Assessment; and now-since 1996-at the Center for Naval Analyses.
Though his work has taken many forms, Dr. McCue says that what he likes best is “to match real-world data to quantitative formulations that make sense in terms of physical reality.”
